name: NBCNews
text:
Senate passes a resolution to fund the government through Dec. 11, averting the possibility of a shutdown.

The bill now heads to President Trump's desk for signature. https://t.co/XKxZwPqwHk

name: NBCNews
text: Alabama Gov. Kay Ivey apologized to Sarah Collins Rudolph, a survivor of a Ku Klux Klan bombing that left her severely injured and killed 4 Black girls, including her sister, in 1963. https://t.co/XnHMoeorTJ

name: NBCNews
text: A global health expert said that the coronavirus is causing "the historic decimation" of the Latino community, ravaging generations of loved ones in Hispanic families. - @NBCLatino https://t.co/AnFo8syEyG

name: NBCNews
text: About 73.1M people watched President Trump debate Joe Biden on television Tuesday night, down from the record 84M who watched Trump's first debate with Hillary Clinton 4 years ago, according to the media measurement company Nielsen. https://t.co/OVsmdjdZ89

name: NBCNews
text: Facebook announced that it will ban any ads in support of the far-right group Qanon and any militarized social movements. - @CNBC https://t.co/Xq5ot9RLVq

name: NBCNews
text: Court approves a settlement totaling $800M from MGM Resorts International and its insurers to more than 4,400 relatives and victims of the Las Vegas Strip shooting, the deadliest in recent U.S. history. https://t.co/mcaSdpKSvz

name: NBCNews
text: A 24-year-old white man has been arrested and faces ethnic intimidation charges in connection with a hate crime targeting a Black suburban Detroit family who displayed a Black Lives Matter sign in their front window, police say. https://t.co/2lQlI3UUxa

name: NBCNews
text: NEW: Nearly 50,000 airline workers are set to be furloughed starting Thursday morning after Congress fails to pass a last-minute deal to extend coronavirus relief aid to the embattled industry. https://t.co/RofqHEpz6k

name: NBCNews
text:
“Here I am with other people in the emergency department, but I can’t be there for my own dad”

Dr. Yvette Calderon recalls losing her father to Covid-19 while treating patients afflicted with the virus. #HospitalHeroes https://t.co/unt6IXIF5G

name: NBCNews
text: Sean Morales-Doyle, deputy director of the Brennan Center’s voting rights and elections program, said there are many state laws that govern who can be in the polls at any given time, who can be a poll watcher and what role they play. https://t.co/q2luAhmmJQ

text: A 19-year-old college student in North Carolina died Monday from Covid-19 complications, school officials say. https://t.co/OgiGCGlPj2
